document_data.name: Improved Silence
document_data.mainbody: '''''Improved silence''''' was an [[alteration]] [[spell]] that created a permanent zone of complete silence.
document_data.Effects:
When cast, ''improved silence'' created a wave of silence that rendered the area around the target completely soundless, similar to how the ''[[silence]]'' spell functioned. All those who were affected could not cast any spells that required vocal components. The effects of ''improved silence'' were permanent unless removed or ''[[dispelled]]'' by magical means.

The spell required verbal and somatic components and had a range of {{SI|100'|'"|long=yes}}. The spell's targets could be creatures or objects. When cast on an unwilling creature, the spell had a chance of being shrugged off.
document_data.History: In the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], [[vampire]] servants of [[Kimber Gallen]] of [[Ravens Bluff]] carried [[coin]]s ensorcelled with the ''improved silence'' spell to aid them in stealth and sneak.{{Cite organized play/LC/The "Life" of the Party|3}}
